claim: A viewer of Monday Night Football would be able to catch WWE Raw during commercial breaks.

supporting.text: Monday Night Football and WWE Raw are broadcast on different networks, making simultaneous viewing impossible without two separate screens.

attacks.text: Monday Night Football and WWE Raw are broadcast on different networks, making simultaneous viewing impossible without two separate screens.
Many viewers have access to picture-in-picture or multi-screen setups, allowing them to watch both broadcasts simultaneously.
Picture-in-picture and multi-screen setups are not universally available and may require additional equipment or subscriptions.
Streaming services often offer delayed or on-demand viewing, so a viewer could technically watch WWE Raw during the commercial breaks of Monday Night Football.
Watching WWE Raw on-demand during commercial breaks would not constitute 'catching' it live, which is implied by the original claim.

supporting.text: Commercial breaks in Monday Night Football are typically short (2-3 minutes), which is insufficient to switch channels and watch a meaningful segment of WWE Raw.

attacks.text: Commercial breaks in Monday Night Football are typically short (2-3 minutes), which is insufficient to switch channels and watch a meaningful segment of WWE Raw.
Modern DVR and streaming services allow viewers to pause live TV, making it possible to switch channels during breaks without missing any content.
Not all viewers have access to DVR or streaming services, limiting the applicability of this counter-argument.
WWE Raw segments, such as quick backstage interviews or short promos, can be as brief as 1-2 minutes, fitting within a typical commercial break.
Such short segments are often incomplete or lack context, reducing the meaningfulness of watching them in isolation.

supporting.text: WWE Raw is a scripted wrestling show with continuous storylines, making it difficult to follow in brief, disjointed segments during football commercials.

attacks.text: WWE Raw is a scripted wrestling show with continuous storylines, making it difficult to follow in brief, disjointed segments during football commercials.
Many WWE Raw segments, such as promos or backstage interviews, are self-contained and can be enjoyed without needing full context.
Even self-contained segments often reference ongoing storylines, making them confusing for casual viewers who miss the full show.
Sports broadcasts often have extended commercial breaks, allowing enough time to follow key moments of WWE Raw.
Extended commercial breaks are unpredictable, and viewers may still miss crucial segments or transitions in WWE Raw.

supporting.text: The scheduling of Monday Night Football and WWE Raw often overlaps, but their live formats prevent seamless switching without missing significant content.

attacks.text: The scheduling of Monday Night Football and WWE Raw often overlaps, but their live formats prevent seamless switching without missing significant content.
Many viewers use DVR or streaming services with pause/rewind functionality, allowing them to switch between programs without missing content.
Even with DVR functionality, live sports and wrestling events are often watched in real-time to avoid spoilers, making switching impractical.
Commercial breaks in Monday Night Football are predictable and long enough to briefly switch to WWE Raw without missing key moments.
WWE Raw also has commercial breaks, which may not align with those of Monday Night Football, reducing the opportunity to switch seamlessly.

supporting.text: Broadcast rights and contracts prevent the same network from airing both programs simultaneously, eliminating the possibility of quick channel switching.

attacks.text: Broadcast rights and contracts prevent the same network from airing both programs simultaneously, eliminating the possibility of quick channel switching.
Some cable providers or streaming services may offer picture-in-picture or multi-view features that allow watching both programs at once.
Such multi-view features are rare, often require premium subscriptions, and may still be restricted by broadcast agreements.
Even if on different networks, viewers could switch channels manually during commercial breaks.
The timing of commercial breaks is rarely synchronized between networks, making seamless switching unlikely.
